poem:
**Questions of Confection**

I ponder this morning over the paper,
a map of mysteries laid out
like an old kitchen tablecloth,
each crease an inquiry:
Does the twisted curve of a chocolate
whisper secrets to your tongue?
Does a samosa know its own geometry?
The martini, poised and glassy,
holds its own taut poem.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: how does the shape of a chocolate change its flavour? Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
